    Function reference

    By function category

    In this section the package functions are listed by their operation. If you want to do things step by step you’ll use these to download and then wrangle data before processing the data into pocketbook format. Essentially you can use the acquire_* functions to download raw data, and then apply the get_* functions to extract a useful tibble from it for further processing. The url functions are basically for reference and not needed in normal circumstances.

    Normally you should just be able to use get_* and carry on from there. The rest is just to show working and help with reproducibility

    You can view the same functions organised into pocketbook topics in the ‘By topic’ section.

    URLs

    url_* functions simply return the address of where the datasets are. They are used by other fsp functions to download data. If things arent working the first thing you can do is manually check these url to see that they are pointing to the right data.

    url_abs()
    URL for the current Annual Business Survey dataset
    url_ag_workforce()
    URL for Defra Agricultural Workforce data
    url_ct()
    URL for the current Consumer Trends dataset
    url_jobs03()
    URL for the current JOBS03 dataset
    url_unctad()
    URL for UNCTAD commodity price indices data

    Acquire data

    acquire_* functions actually download data. By default they download into a temporary file, but you can specify a folder to download to. These functions return the path to the downloaded file. You can use the output of acquire_* functions with, eg read.csv() or other similar functions.

    acquire_ag_workforce()
    Download Defra Agricultural Workforce dataset
    acquire_ct()
    Download ONS Consumer Trends dataset
    acquire_jobs03()
    Download ONS JOBS03 dataset
    acquire_unctad()
    Extract UNCTAD Commodity Price indices

    Get data

    get_* functions wrap around url and acquire, reading in data and returning a tibble. In most cases they also do a bit of light processing, eg cleaning up variable names. For some source datasets they may return an element of the underlying data, such as only the monthly or yearly data, or metadata about the dataset contents.

    get_ag_workforce()
    Extract data from an Agricultural workforce ods file
    get_ct_metadata()
    Get Consumer Trends metadata
    get_ct_quarter()
    Get Consumer Trends quarterly data
    get_ct_year()
    Get Consumer Trends annual data
    get_jobs03()
    Extract data from a JOBS03 xls file
    get_unctad()
    Get UNCTAD data
    get_unctad_metadata()
    Get UNCTAD metadata

    Misc functions

    Other helpful stuff

    jobs03_sectors()
    Dataset of JOBS03 SIC codes and food chain sectors
    compile_ag_workforce()
    Compile GB Agricultural workforce data

    By pocketbook topic

    The same functions as described in the category section, but organised by data source and pocketbook topic

    Consumer Trends

    ONS Consumer Trends stuff

    acquire_ct()
    Download ONS Consumer Trends dataset
    get_ct_metadata()
    Get Consumer Trends metadata
    get_ct_quarter()
    Get Consumer Trends quarterly data
    get_ct_year()
    Get Consumer Trends annual data
    url_ct()
    URL for the current Consumer Trends dataset

    Employment

    ONS employment stuff

    acquire_jobs03()
    Download ONS JOBS03 dataset
    get_jobs03()
    Extract data from a JOBS03 xls file
    jobs03_AUK_sectors()
    Dataset of AUK JOBS03 SIC codes and food chain sectors
    jobs03_sectors()
    Dataset of JOBS03 SIC codes and food chain sectors
    url_jobs03()
    URL for the current JOBS03 dataset

    Agricultural workforce

    Defra agri workforce stuff

    acquire_ag_workforce()
    Download Defra Agricultural Workforce dataset
    compile_ag_workforce()
    Compile GB Agricultural workforce data
    get_ag_workforce()
    Extract data from an Agricultural workforce ods file
    url_ag_workforce()
    URL for Defra Agricultural Workforce data

    Commodity ptices

    UNCTAD commodity prices stuff

    acquire_unctad()
    Extract UNCTAD Commodity Price indices
    get_unctad()
    Get UNCTAD data
    get_unctad_metadata()
    Get UNCTAD metadata
    url_unctad()
    URL for UNCTAD commodity price indices data
